titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. At the Athenaeum— W. Tudor. Panorama of Athens— at Cruft’s— Then at Greenwood’s— Tooth-drawn— Dined at Jos: Hall’s. Came out with Quincy to my father’s— Charles admitted to College— Shaw here.
2. Heard Mr Whitney. Matthew 6.34. A.M— 2. Cor: VII.2. P.M— Genl. Milton—& his daughter here.

3. Boston— Noon— W. Tudor. Letter from P.U.S. Lima— Dined at S. Cobb’s— Trustees humane Society— Govr. Brooks. Guille’s Balloon. Evening and Night Storm— S. Gardner & N. Gorham— Shaler & Eustis at Quincy.
4. Shaler & Folsom— Branch Bank U.S— Story’s Address. Dined with Suffolk Bar at Concert-Hall— Eve at R. Derby’s, Chess— Dr. Townsend— Jos. Hall— Engaged to Silsbee 19th and to Story 20th.

5. With Dr Parkman. New & Marine Hospitals— Genl. Dearborn, Dr Townsend— Jaques— Wiggen’s Capucin Chapel— H Welsh. G. W. A. and J. Q. A Boyd— Dined at W. Gray’s— Went first to Cambridge— Prest. Kirkland— Charles’s examinn. Eve at Hall’s.

6— De Grand here— Jos. N. Howe’s business— Seal— At E. Crufts—and at B. Dearborn’s— Crufts Store—opened my books— Dined at W. Eustiss. My brother and George— Mrs Morton ill— Evening at Mrs Gerry’s. Call on Dr Jarvis at Mr Burr’s.
7. Athenaeum— J. Dodge & Hayti— Letter to D. Brent & draft to Vivés— Dined at S. Parkman’s— Chipman &c— Mrs A— Eve at W. C. Gray’s— At De Grand’s— Artiguenave.

8. Onis’s Book. Miss Hinckley— Mrs A went to Quincy— Visit from Genl. Brown & J. J. Austin— Charles in town. Paid visits— Mason, Callender, J. Phillips— Athenaeum— Captn. Partridge— Dined at G. Blake’s. Brown, Scott, Towson &c— W. Tudor’s Book—to Quincy with Shaw.
9. Bath with G. & J. Heard W. Coleman Luke 18.18. Proverbs 2.11. De Grand— Brown, Scott, Kirby, Lieutt. Monroe &c— Quincy’s, Beale and Marston at eve—
10. From Quincy to Brookline. Mr Colman’s 8 Miles— Worcester Turnpike— Sibley’s Hotel. Needham 8. Miles— Dinner— To Hamilton’s, at Framingham— 7 1/4 Miles— Dr Baldwin— Ex-Senator Maynard— Cheney—

11. Messenger from Quincy— Fire at my father’s House— We proceed, to Wesson’s at Westborough— 10 Miles—to Sikes’s at Worcester 9. Miles. W. N Boylston there— Court of Sessions— Dr. Bancroft— Dr. Fiske— Allen, Sheriff Ward, Hastings, Lincoln, Bigelow— Antiquarian Society. Thomas Selectmen of Princeton, Coll. Gill—to Princeton 15 Miles— Half way cavalcade-escort— Addresses— Rain—
12. John went for Charles— Rainy morning. Walk with George— Charles arrived. Dr Thayer of Lancaster, and Mr and Mrs Clarke dined here— Evening, fair.
13. Walked to the top of Wachusett hill— Fair day. Cool— returned to dinner— Nichollss re-collections— George unwell.

14. Left Princeton with my father— Mr Boylston, John and Charles, through Sterling to Lancaster 12 Miles— Dined at Rand’s— Boylston’s Grandson— Call at A. Packard’s— Boylston with the boys returned to Princeton— Came with my father to Stow— Whitmore’s 13 Miles— Lancaster Cotton Factory

15. From Stow through Waltham to Watertown— Stratton’s 16 Miles—to Boston 7. Miles— Dined at Jas H. Foster’s— Athenaeum. Budget of despatches— Silsbee— Marston— Home to my father’s at Quincy— Traces of the fire— Shaw came out.
16. Heard Dr Porter of Roxbury— Job. 7.1— and Ezekiel 33.13. Dr Porter & his nephew here— Ride with my father. Captn. Beale Jos. Quincy & Son here— Rain
17. Shaw to Boston— Wrote to D. Brent— Call at Mr. J. Greenleaf’s— Note from Lieutt. Stockton and answer— ride P.M. with my father— Marston, evening here.
18. VI. To Boston— Mrs Jenks’s— Lieutt. Stockton—his captures—to report— Athenaeum P.M. Stewart the Painter— W. S. Shaw. Eve at Jos. Hall’s—about Palfrey.

19. V:30. John & Charles arrived from Princeton last Night. Pickman came with invitation from his father— Took John with me to Salem— Stop at B. Pickman’s. Installation of James Flint— Dined at Silsbee’s— Dr Holyoke— Crowninshield. Eve at Pickman’s— Dr Kilham— Peabody’s— Peele— Jas Perkins & J. T. Apthorp with memorial from Boston

20. VI: B. W. Crowninshield— Silsbee, Story—visited the Museum. Ride with Pickman— Leslie’s Bridge Endicott’s place— John to Nahant. Dined at Judge Story’s— Eve at Mr Peabody’s. Supper. Coll. T. Pickering— Mr and Mrs Rogers yesterday & 3 children. Mrs Pickman unwell—daughters Martha and Elizabeth. Mrs Brazer, here.— Mr & Mrs Felt out of town

21. VI. Story— Returned to Boston— Call on Commodore Hull— Athenaeum— Recd. despatches—dined at Lieutt. Govr. Phillips’s—30 persons— Convn. with Mr Webster—about Stockton— Eve at J. H. Foster’s and Judge Davis’s.
22. V:45. Come: Bainbridge called— Stockton. J. Q. A. Boyd. visit to E. Everett— Dined at J. P. Davis’s— Out to Quincy, with W. S. Shaw and John
23. VI:15. Professor Ware—dined here. Degrand, walked from Boston— Eve with George at Quincy’s—
24. VI— Ride with my brother to the Mount Wollaston farm. Loud of Weymouth—his claim on Russia— Rain P.M— Eve at Quincy’s family party—
25. VI:15. To Boston with George. Conversation with D. Webster. Dined at Com: Bainbridge’s— Athenaeum— Voluminous despatches. Eve with Shaw at Dr Welsh’s— Call at Mrs Storer’s—
26. VI— Reading despatches— At E. Everett’s Lecture on Athens—dined at B. Joy’s— Eve, came out to Quincy
27. V:30— George to Boston— Shaw with Stewart the painter here, for Doggett— Harriet Welsh came out with George, numerous evening party and dance.

28. VI. With Charles to Cambridge— His examinn. by Channing in Sallust—admitted— Prest. Kirkland— George 30— John 45— At Dr. Waterhouse’s—to Boston— G. Blake, at his Office— Judge Davis— Welles— Dined at I. Thorndike’s— Sumner— Moffat, methodist preacher. Athenaeum— Marshal Harris— Jos. Hall.

29. V:15. Breakfast with Hall— Medford. Govr Brookes—return— Wait and Tredwell’s new printing Press— George in town— Dined at Little’s, with Genl. Boyd— Genl. Dearborn— Degrand— Came out to Quincy with George— Shaw here.
30. V:15. Sleepless Night. Heard Walter’s first essay. Exodus 3.14. 2. Cor. 4.18. Quincy’s— Mrs Black. Beale, Marston’s here at Eve— Degrand. Howe’s papers.
